definition: to create something from nothing (idiom)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: 'I firmly believe that my worry is based in fantasy land, ' Mr. Sollars says.
sentences.chinese: 索拉斯说，“我坚信，我的担心完全是无中生有。

sentences.english: I suspect that you'll discover that many of your assumptions are incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 我猜想，你会发现你的许多猜测是无中生有。

sentences.english: We express strong dissatisfaction over the relevant report which is complete fabrication.
sentences.chinese: 有关报道纯属无中生有，我们对此表示强烈不满。

sentences.english: Or maybe I'm just contributing to the blaring non-issue alarmism here.
sentences.chinese: 或许我现在也在制造一些无中生有的噪音罢了。

sentences.english: Second, specific padding out of nothing.
sentences.chinese: 第二，具体补白，无中生有。

sentences.english: Kagan's reputation as a harsh grader is unfounded.
sentences.chinese: 关于卡刚严苛评级的坏名声属无中生有。

sentences.english: But his lawyer said the new charges are "invented".
sentences.chinese: 他的律师回应说，这些指控是无中生有。

definition: fabrication relying on nothing (idiom); frame-up
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to make up/to fabricate
lit. to graft flowers onto a tree/to surreptitiously substitute one thing for another (idiom)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
see 捕風捉影|捕风捉影[bu3 feng1 zhuo1 ying3]
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
random lies and falsehoods
to invert right and wrong
to confuse right and wrong (idiom)
to start rumours and create trouble
